result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose A Colon De Jesus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes: Straight time.  Sentence credit for 30 days were granted.  TIME SERVED.
In lieu of Costs/DNA Surcharge defendant to serve 6 days Jail.  Sentence credit for 6 day were granted.  TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose A Colon De Jesus

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received October 25, 2016 Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: October 17, 2016
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jose A Colon De Jesus in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter, sworn in.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.

Court orders the following:  Count #2.  

Imposed:  30 days jail.  (30 days credit) TIME SERVED.

In lieu of costs and DNA surcharge:  6 days jail.  (6 days credit).  TIME SERVED.

Defendant to submit to and provide a DNA sample.
Received October 7, 2016,   State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Received October 6, 2016, from Atty Rosario requesting all 3 cases be scheduled for Oct 17th for final resolution
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
counseling

Defendant Jose A Colon De Jesus in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter, sworn in.  Court set case for trial.  JSH date ok with Patrick Ryan.  Judge adivses no interpreter is needed to be scheduled for the jury trial at this time.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney J Anthony Rosario in court.   Defendant Jose A Colon De Jesus did not appear.   Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared.  Attorney Rosario advises he has not heard from his client.  State requests a capias.  Court assesses costs against the defendant for his nonappearance to go towards the spanish interpreter.  Defendant must make all court appearances from here on out, authorization is revoked.  OK with Dawn Maldonado.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney J Anthony Rosario in court.   Defendant Jose A Colon De Jesus did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Authorization on file.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Next date ok with Patrick Ryan.
Hearing at 04-13-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Jose A Colon De Jesus in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter, sworn in.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 02-10-2016 08:30 am
to appear

Attorney J Anthony Rosario in court.   Defendant Jose A Colon De Jesus did not appear.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Attorney appears by authorization. Next date is the deadling to file motions.  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Defendant appeared late, had another court appearance in G49.
Hearing at 01-11-2016 03:00 pm
Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.  Defendant allowed to return to the residence accompanied by a peace officer.

Defendant Jose A Colon De Jesus in court.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.
  Hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
